sys_metadata_link.payload:
true
The change requester is responsible for raising the change request. A requester is anyone in the organization who needs a change to be made, and may submit change requests on behalf of other users. When the change request is created, all necessary information for its assessment and authorization is captured. Once the information has been captured, the change request is submitted for review to filter out incomplete, impractical, or duplicate requests. 

Review the recommended proven practice Change Request form for creating and submitting a draft change. You can configure the form layout by adding, rearranging, or removing fields.

]]>
false change_form_layout 3 6 false true The following screenshot illustrates the recommended proven practice Change Request form for creating and submitting a draft change.

The change requester can create the change in New state and only be required to add the Requested by and a Short description to save it.

To submit a change for approval, the following fields are mandatory:

  • Description
  • Justification
  • Implementation plan
  • Risk and impact analysis
  • Backout plan
  • Test plan
  • Planned start date
  • Planned end date

If the change Type is Emergency, then it is possible to set the start and end dates in the past to cover a change that was implemented.

To configure the Change Request form based on proven process recommendations:

  1. Click the form context menu and select Configure > Form Design to add or remove fields.
    Field Comments 
     Category Remove from the form.
     Requested by date Remove from the form.
  2. Add or update the Hint text for the following fields:
     Field Description 
     Configuration item Add additional CIs through related lists at the bottom of the form.
     Assignment group The group responsible for owning the change.
     Assigned to The individual responsible for owning the change.
  3. Add UI policies as follows:
    • Make Requested by and Short description mandatory.
    • Make the following fields mandatory for all states except New or Canceled:
      • Configuration item
      • Description
      • Assigned to
      • Justification
      • Implementation plan
      • Risk and impact analysis
      • Backout plan
      • Test plan field
      • Planned start date
      • Planned end date
  4. Add client scripts for the following actions:
    • Prevent the Planned start and Planned end date fields from allowing a date in the past if the Type is Normal or Standard.
    • Ensure Planned start and Planned end dates can be in the past for Emergency changes.

To configure the Change Task form based on proven practice recommendations:

  1. Click the form context menu, and select Configure > UI Policies.
  2. Add a UI policy on the change task to make the Type field mandatory for all states.
